MotoGP Malaysia: Pebalap Indonesia Meninggal, Marquez Berduka
02 Nov 2019, 19:27 by , https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Marc Marquez berduka atas meninggalnya pebalap Indonesia, Afridza Munandar, jelang MotoGP Malaysia. (Adrian DENNIS / AFP)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- Jelang MotoGP Malaysia, pebalap muda Indonesia Afridza Munandar meninggal dunia di ajang balapan Asia Talent Cup 2019 di Sirkuit Sepang, Sabtu (2/11).Pebalap MotoGP dari tim Honda, Marc Marquez, menyampaikan rasa duka cita atas meninggalnya Afridza. Dalam akun Instagram, Marquez menuliskan ekspresi belasungkawa kabar duka tersebut."Hari berkabung di dunia balap motor. Afridza Munandar telah meninggal dunia sore ini setelah kecelakaan di ajang Asian Talent Cup. Istirahat dalam damai, Afridza," demikian tulis Marquez dengan mengunggah foto Afridza di Instagramnya.Sebelumnya, pihak Dorna melalui situs akun Twitter MotoGP mengeluarkan cuitan belasungkawa atas meninggalnya Afridza.



"Pebalap Asia Talent Cup Afridza Munandar telah meninggal dunia usai kecelakaan di balapan ATC di Sepang. Kami mengucapkan simpati yang mendalam untuk keluarga Afridza dan teman-temannya," tulis akun MotoGP.Cuitan MotoGP tersebut pun turut dikomentari pebalap Moto2 adik Marquez, Alex Marquez: "Istirahat dalam damai."Afridza mengalami insiden kecelakaan dengan pebalap Jepang Shinji Ogu saat memasuki tikungan ke-10 di lap pertama balapan Asia Talent Cup 2019. Kecelakaan itu membuat bendera merah dikibarkan pertanda dihentikannya balapan.Pebalap berusia 20 tahun itu lantas dapat penanganan medis pertama kali di sisi lintasan. Tak berselang lama, ia dilarikan ke rumah sakit Kuala Lumpur menggunakan helikopter.



Meski cepat mendapatkan penanganan dari petugas medis di lintasan dan saat berada di rumah sakit, nyawa Afridza tidak tertolong.Live streaming balapan MotoGP Malaysia 2019, Minggu (3/11), dapat disaksikan di CNNIndonesia.com. Sementara siaran langsung MotoGP Malaysia 2019 dapat diikuti di Trans7. (bac/jal)

Malaysian MotoGP: Indonesian Racer Dead, Marquez Grieves
02 Nov 2019, 19:27 by, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Marc Marquez mourns the death of Indonesian rider, Afridza Munandar, ahead of the Malaysian MotoGP. (Adrian DENNIS / AFP)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia - Ahead of the Malaysian MotoGP, young Indonesian rider Afridza Munandar died at the 2019 Asia Talent Cup race at the Sepang Circuit, Saturday (2/11). MotoGP rider from Honda team, Marc Marquez, expressed his sorrow over the death of the 2019 Asian Talent Cup race at the Sepang Circuit, Saturday (2/11). Afridza. In his Instagram account, Marquez wrote an expression of condolences for the sad news: "Day of mourning in the world of motor racing. Afridza Munandar died this afternoon after an accident at the Asian Talent Cup. Rest in peace, Afridza," Marquez wrote by uploading Afridza photos on Instagram. Previously, Dorna via the MotoGP Twitter account site issued condolences for the death of Afridza.



"Asia Talent Cup racer Afridza Munandar has died after an accident at the ATC race in Sepang. We express our deep sympathy for the Afridza family and friends," wrote the MotoGP account. "Rest in peace." Afridza had an accident with Japanese racer Shinji Ogu as he entered the 10th bend on the first lap of the 2019 Asia Talent Cup race. The accident caused the red flag to be hoisted as a sign of a halt to the race. The 20-year-old rider then got his first medical treatment times on the side of the track. Not long after, he was rushed to the Kuala Lumpur hospital by helicopter.



Although quickly getting treatment from medical staff on the track and while in the hospital, Afridza's life was beyond help. Live streaming of the Malaysian MotoGP 2019 race on Sunday (3/11), can be watched on CNNIndonesia.com. While the live broadcast of MotoGP Malaysia 2019 can be followed on Trans7. (bac / jal)
